body:
[![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9b/Wikiecrins.jpg/800px-Wikiecrins.jpg)](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glacier_Blanc)

We completely redesigned the selection of digital equipment. It was done
[here](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/pull/905).

In concrete terms, **instead of 6 questions in a row, the user fills in
his digital heritage in a single screen**, with the questions (age,
characteristics) being asked afterwards for the equipment filled in.

![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-03-22
12-14-53](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/111981663-40e9de80-8b08-11eb-8d1e-61a6de47e51a.png)

This is an important step towards a better consideration of the digital
footprint, previously limited by the inflation of questions that would
result.

Not much else in this version, but the next one will be substantial üòâ
name: Glacier blanc

body:
![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/ad/Pic_Montferrat.jpg/400px-Pic_Montferrat.jpg)

> In a nutshell: transportation question improvements üö¶ ‚Ñπ This is a
> small version, with some improvements but nothing earth-shattering.
> It's only a minor release.

-   your last simulation done on the browser, if there is one is
    automatically loaded üßô‚ôÇÔ∏è

-   we have separated the calculation of the aircraft footprint ‚úà into
    three questions, by mail type: short, medium, long. The calculation
    is more reliable. We also ask the question "do you fly" beforehand
    to free those who are not concerned by this emission item

-   we added a FAQ ‚ùî on the /contribute page. Indeed, we have many
    (many) feedbacks, often similar.

-   we improved the car questions üöó, especially to avoid talking about
    "your" car when the user said he didn't have one

-   the üöó emoji was not suitable to represent the transportation
    category, leading some people who use only a little car, but other
    means of transportation to believe a bug in our model. It is now
    this one: üö¶
name: Ossoue

body:
![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/68/Absolute_MtBlanc_01.jpg/400px-Absolute_MtBlanc_01.jpg)

> In short: Food, average footprint and some bugs

For this 2nd version of Our Climate Gestures, we listened to the already
numerous feedbacks and made these main changes.

## Food item

We introduce the choice of breakfast type:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/91868807-6ea72d00-ec75-11ea-81bb-982cac0ea55a.png)

As well as a new diet selector, much less rigid than a single diet.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/91868962-9c8c7180-ec75-11ea-86fc-2f12f26baf35.png)

## More representative default values

The simulator, by default, now indicates 11.7 tons, a figure closer to
the average footprint of a French person (we were previously at 10).

## Removal of the "finance" item

As explained in \#24 , the attribution of a footprint to the money we
have in the bank was a double counting. We have removed it.

## üêõ shared car bug

In short, we were significantly overestimating the footprint of the
shared car rental.

We now attribute a share of the vehicle's construction to each person
who rents a car to get around. We were making the mistake of attributing
*all of the* construction to him.
name: Bossons

body:
[![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/86/Chambeyron-lac_du_marinet.jpg/640px-Chambeyron-lac_du_marinet.jpg)](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aiguille_de_Chambeyron)

In this version, nice improvements for the üöó and the üèç, among others!

-   the size of the cars now allows us to take into account the
    construction of the vehicle, especially for the electric
    [here](https://github.com/betagouv/ecolab-data/pull/888)
-   the size now influences the consumption of the electric car
-   added questions on motorcycles and scooters
    [here](https://github.com/betagouv/ecolab-data/pull/891)
-   correction of the eco-driving factor downwards
-   correction of the footprint of the television, which was
    underestimated by a factor of 5 because of an unwelcome copy-paste
    [here](https://github.com/betagouv/ecolab-data/pull/889/commits/bed18fa7150e5676460546347721e7f9b5e19a08)

-   source reliability for the footprint of housing construction
    [here](https://github.com/betagouv/ecolab-data/pull/908)
name: Marinet

body: [![Glacier des Gabi√©tous](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/45/Jeu_de_lumiere_aux_deux_alpes_02.JPG/640px-Jeu_de_lumiere_aux_deux_alpes_02.JPG)](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Les_Deux_Alpes) > The glacier des deux alpes is closed early this year > In brief: - New breakfasts & hot drinks - New waste calculation model > - Suggested answers in the form of buttons - Optimization of the > weight of the site ## New breakfasts & hot drinks ü•ê‚òïÔ∏è ![width="800" alt="question-boissons-chaudes"](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55186402/180246298-6037be7a-cd19-4d7c-b1b4-d14e9a7456b8.png) The breakfast question has been improved with new suggestions. A hot beverage question also makes an appearance! ## New waste calculation model üöÆ The trash footprint is evolving! A more accurate model updates the waste footprint with a more recent source. All discussions are in [this thread](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/pull/1110). A mosaic of eco-gestures has also been added. ## Suggested responses in the form of buttons ‚ú® The suggestions are now more visible. Some mosaics also show suggestions, which did not exist before, like the meal selection! ![width="800" alt="suggestions-repas"](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55186402/180241201-1fe64d79-03ee-43f8-a26b-34ac1b515ee8.gif) ## Optimization of the weight of the site ‚ÜòÔ∏è In terms of the weight of the loaded javascript, we go from 1.4mo to 1.1, which is -20%. The performance of the site has been improved in an eco-design approach. The only visible difference is the font. All the advances at this level are in [this discussion](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/pull/478).
name: Deux alpes

body:
[![Glacier des
Gabi√©tous](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9d/Gavarnie_recti_small_Wikimedia_Commons.jpg/640px-Gavarnie_recti_small_Wikimedia_Commons.jpg)](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glacier_des_Gabi√©tous)

> In short: - New animated graphic during the simulation - New end
> screen highlighting the climate goal - New end screen to explore one's
> footprint by subcategory (car, airplane, heating, etc.) - New end
> screen to introduce actions - More personalized end screen (simulation
> not started, not finished, low climate score, etc.) - Sharing one's
> simulation with a set of emojis - New rhetorical "utilities" question

## New animated graphic during the simulation üìä

![Recording 2022-06-22 at 18 51
50](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/175094066-43f5bce9-4237-4512-804c-a3b05e1c52e8.gif)

## New end screen highlighting the climate goal üéØ

![Recording 2022-06-28 at 12 50
44](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/176161585-056d15aa-254d-4a64-aa24-2fb2c991d73a.gif)

## New end screen to explore one's footprint by subcategory (car, airplane, heating, etc) üß±

![Recording 2022-06-28 at 12 51
58](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/176161770-02cfa4e3-78c8-416d-abd5-9451ca78b71e.gif)

## New end screen to introduce actions üèÅ

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/176161176-52159706-1edb-4e4f-952f-78e04d319032.png)

## More customized end screen (simulation not started, not finished, low climate score, etc.) üë§

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/176161146-fd4e8d70-3be7-4ea1-9816-93761eecde0a.png)

## Sharing one's simulation with a set of emojis üê¶Ô∏è

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/176162250-7c96207f-4381-4e51-869d-48aa966f8fd3.png)

## New "utility" rhetorical question üèõÔ∏è

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/176162161-ed8feb5b-d074-4c36-bd98-b646a03f7385.png)

## Improvement of our presentation component

For the tutorial, and the end screen, we monitor the slide through rate.
We made the next button more obvious via an animation, and now display
the slides as circles above the slides.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/176162070-5558bb9f-cdb3-47f4-abdb-a1d39171efc3.png)

Its performance on the end screen has also been improved, for small
processors.

## New educational cards

We've added comprehensive worksheets to more thoroughly explore what you
can do for your digital footprint, via telecommuting, for your personal
savings, etc.

‚û°Ô∏è https://nosgestesclimat.fr/actions/plus

[![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/176163299-c8010c49-e66b-42de-a3cc-0ea0848c8dfd.png)](https://nosgestesclimat.fr/actions/plus)

## Other improvements

We are starting to work on indexing the site on search engines, and
making incremental improvements to the calculation model.
name: Gabi√©tous (Gavarnie)

body:
> In short: üöÄ This is the 1st beta version of Our Climate Gestures,
> released in June 2020.

![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/65/Refuge_et_Pic_de_l'√âtendard_(Savoie).JPG/400px-Refuge_et_Pic_de_l'√âtendard_(Savoie).JPG)

It's essentially a rehash of the 2.6 model of Avenir Climatique's MicMac
tool, which resided in a spreadsheet file to download. MicMac Web was
not updated anymore, it was necessary to launch a new version of the
interface, more modern, interactive, easy to evolve and making total
transparency on the calculations.

This repository contains the complete calculation model of Our Climate
Gestures, in the form of YAML [publicodes](https://publi.codes) files.

The tool is in *beta* version: it is usable and already informative, but
we have already identified many unsatisfactory points: - the total is
not the expected 11.2 tons - the numerical part is not complete, the
footprint is underestimated - the only question for the diet is very
disappointing - etc.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/89622912-0e9ab200-d894-11ea-9226-c4af37549cd7.png)
name: √âtendard

body:
[![Glacier de las
N√©ous](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a8/Glacier_de_Las_N√©ous_8_ao√ªt_1905.png/547px-Glacier_de_Las_N√©ous_8_ao√ªt_1905.png)](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glacier_de_las_N√©ous)

> In a nutshell: - a tutorial appears before the test - seasonal, local
> food - we assist you in filling your miles in the car - lots of new
> content on the screen/actions - lots of other improvements to the
> template and the site

## A pre-test tutorial üßëüè´

We've added a tutorial for those unfamiliar with the concept of climate
footprints and personal consumption climate footprints. This is part of
our strategy to open up to audiences not yet aware of these topics.

[The Ministry of the Environment is demoing this
here](https://twitter.com/i/status/1488059482647236608).

## Seasonal, local food üåª üöõ

From Agribalyse, we have developed climate footprint variation models
corresponding to seasonal and local diets.

![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/140048614-299fc659-6c87-441c-ab91-4b79e7c44b11.gif)

To our knowledge, these improvements are groundbreaking work! You will
see that these "options" have little influence if your diet is not
already strongly vegetarian.

## New screen to help you enter mileage while driving ‚å®Ô∏è üõ£Ô∏è

You may have noticed that it's hard to answer the question "How many
miles do you drive each year?" all at once.

So have we: so we've designed a form to help with that entry.

![Aide √† la saisie km voiture -
d√©mo](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/151338682-c79c82d3-4582-4981-98ab-401dc8c81206.gif)

Big bonus: this form also avoids estimating a vehicle fill rate, which
is usually a very risky task.

## Improvements to the "action" path üéØ

-   two new actions to switch to seasonal and local food
-   we improved the action to reduce the temperature of the home: we now
    ask you your current temperature
-   a new action to go vegan
-   we separated the actions into different ranges, from "more than a
    ton" to "less than 10kg", and finally to "unquantified actions".

## Gas prices üî•

You will surely have seen it: gas prices are exploding in France.
Between +40% and +110% in a few months. So we have revised upwards our
tool to help estimate kWh from ‚Ç¨/month.

To do so, we have reimplemented the gas bill at the regulated rate,
including the various taxes and subscriptions that modify this figure.

## New profile page

A small button appears on the home page, it indicates that you already
have data on nosgestesclimat.fr. As before, we have no data on our
servers, everything is local on your browser.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/151852468-1e9d0cf1-a19e-4540-8c9a-2bf9beb0c6da.png)

Above all, the profile page has a new look, it is now much easier to
navigate through your answers.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/151852657-f06c1d34-fc05-4c4a-8d23-8304cacfc4ea.png)

## Ecodesign üèãÔ∏è

*Let's keep in mind that the footprint of the service and use of a
website in France is very small and already in general naturally
optimized by developers. The environmental impact of digital is mainly
related to manufacturing [(70% for example for a
smartphone)](https://librairie.ademe.fr/cadic/5311/infographie-preferer-smartphone-reconditionne.pdf?modal=false).*

### Small screens

We continue to work to support small screens.

Here are the improvements on iPhone5 SE.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/144875622-2991b5a6-69c9-4c04-9422-48c727cc81af.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/144875673-c96e2098-22bb-4e71-b993-3c121fd008a6.png)

To do this, we have optimized the footprint distribution graph,
integrating the texts in the bars. It has also been animated, which
makes it much easier to understand the impact of choices in the input.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/151852263-5fb7fe31-e13e-4ce5-96a8-4794d19f5ce7.png)

### Hosting the site

We [asked](https://answers.netlify.com/t/low-carbon-european-cdn/48784)
our host (Netlify), if it would be possible for them to implement a
server in France so that our users can see their site served from
France, rather than from Germany currently.

## Coming in 2022

See our roadmap for the calculation model
[here](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/projects/1).
name: Las N√©ous

body: [![Glacier de G√©broulaz](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a4/Glacier_de_G√©broulaz2.jpg/640px-Glacier_de_G√©broulaz2.jpg)](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glacier_de_G√©broulaz) > In short: - Arrival of the survey mode - A new metric: oil - > Improvements in the calculation model: caravan, camping car, car fuel, > digital ... - Improvements in the actions: buy an electric car, > subsidy for the purchase of a bicycle - New educational resources ## Arrival of the survey mode! üíæ - **What is it?** The "survey" mode in Our Climate Gestures allows you to do the test with several people while saving the data in a perennial way (total carbon footprint and by category). This mode can be particularly interesting in the context of a workshop or an event, a [facilitator guide](https://nosgestesclimat.fr/groupe/guide) is available to help you! ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55186402/171632300-dba6d437-a9bd-44b3-afc3-874c1e7307d6.png) - **The** arrival of this new mode is accompanied by an additional feature that allows you to add a few questions to collect additional information as an introduction to the test. For example, this can be useful to organize a survey at the scale of an organization while allowing to filter the results by type of respondent (status...), age, place of living (while taking care not to compromise the standards of RGPD). We have also worked on the security of the surveys to avoid the introduction of vulnerabilities in our database via this feature. You can find all the info in our [documentation](https://nosgestesclimat.fr/groupe/documentation-contexte)! - In the previous version, any user who logged in to the survey appeared in the**visualization** graph. Some people counted as 1 participant without even having taken the test (with a score corresponding to the default values) and the ghost visits distorted the results (especially the average value!). This is no longer the case in this version since the data displayed is filtered by excluding users who completed less than 10% of the test questions. In case the survey is customized (see above), an additional filter is applied to display only the participants who completed the context questions. ## A new metric: oil! üõ¢ To better visualize the amount of oil we consume in our lives, we decided to add to Our Climate Gestures the number of corresponding full tanks, in addition to the CO‚ÇÇe. For the moment, this metric is reported only on direct oil-related emissions (travel, oil heating ...). The way to both highlight our dependence on these fossil fuels but also to better visualize the impact of actions we can put in place: the number of trips to the pump speaks more than tons of CO‚ÇÇe, so swipe on the end screen to see your oil impact! ## Improvements to the calculation model üßÆ - **Added caravan & motorhome** There are now more choices in Our Climate Gestures for going on vacation! Caravans and motor homes have found their place. Attention, for the caravan, the number of kilometers traveled is well to include in the kilometers traveled by car. More information on the methodology in issue \#1317 ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/160854704-aa5b1010-e8f9-43cb-966b-ba80e6a8f731.png) - **Change in passenger ratio** With the arrival of the assistance for entering the kilometers in [the last release](https://nosgestesclimat.fr/nouveaut%C3%A9s/las-n%C3%A9ous), a question remained about the choice of the vehicle's filling rate applied to attribute the depreciation to the different users of the car. The details are available in issue \#1337 and in the [note of the variable "passenger ratio"](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/blob/8fe4b633502fe52dda7eccdc0e9db01b9f677e57/data/transport/transport%20.%20voiture.yaml#L53). - **More choice of fuels** Diesel (B7 or B10), gasoline (E5 or E10) or E85 gasoline (biofuels), you can choose! However, beware of the message sent to the user when he selects biofuels. The carbon impact is certainly lower, but the emission factor is particularly uncertain: the issues related to land use are not taken into account! A notification is therefore displayed to explain this issue! All the info and discussions are in the corresponding issue \#1396! - **Improvement of the digital mosaic** New objects have been added for the digital objects mosaic \#1359 : - üéµ bluetooth speaker - üîä voice speaker - ‚åöÔ∏è connected watch - üïπ living room console - üéÆ portable console - **New heating modes** It is now possible to choose the heat pump (\#1360)! Thoughts are underway to add heat networks as well. ## Improvements in actions üí™ - **An action "Buy an electric car" makes its appearance.** Proposed in case you already own a car, this action allows users to realize the impact (positive or negative) of buying a new or used electric car according to the kilometers driven per year - **Adding mesaidesvelo.fr in the actions** Adding a link to [mesaidesvelo.fr](https://mesaidesvelo.fr/) in the relevant actions. The tool is developed by @mquandalle, who is a developer on mon-entreprise.fr, and mesaidesvelo.fr is already integrated on the official website ## A new way to contribute üë• Contributing is made easier for non-devs contributors! Repositories have been configured to allow you to modify or add new features in real time via a development environment directly in your browser. We explain everything in the [Gitpod tutorial](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#vous-voulez-contribuer-comme-un-pro)! ## New resources üìö In order to help you during your animations but also to allow you to question your own results, [guide sheets are online](https://nosgestesclimat.fr/groupe/guide)! **Full Changelog:** https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/compare/1.5.0...1.6.0
name: G√©broulaz

body:
[![E0EetUdXsAIBhK5 resized
resized](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/121914885-f8bb1080-cd32-11eb-898b-fa39bae7a331.jpeg)](https://mobile.twitter.com/EtienneBerthie2/status/1387426262306656265)

> Summary: - we have reworked the question on household appliances,
> asking for a list of appliances instead of an annual expense, and made
> the calculations more reliable - we have launched the `conference`
> function on the home page
>
> This release note borrows the name of research work that analyzed the
> evolution of more than 200,000 terrestrial glaciers by analyzing
> satellite images. [More info
> here](https://mobile.twitter.com/EtienneBerthie2/status/1387426288646987777)

## Footprint of the appliances

We go from a monetary factor to a list of possessions.

![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-06-14
17-09-17](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/121915179-446dba00-cd33-11eb-8406-1eb0828a0e7d.png)

So we were probably overestimating the default footprint of household
appliances by a lot, as noted
[here](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/issues/948).

Conversely, in this new version, the user is prevented from forgetting
recent purchases, as he is presented with a list that is not complete,
but already quite extensive.

We were overestimating the footprint of household appliances as well
because it was attributed entirely to the individual. We now divide it
by the number of inhabitants of the house.

## Conference mode launched in the foreground

The feature is now open to everyone on the home page.

It allows friends, colleagues and workgroups to calculate their
footprint together in an interactive way.

![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-06-14
17-10-04](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/121915284-5ea79800-cd33-11eb-8530-fe334eef9cd7.png)

A new guide allows to understand the principle before starting.

![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-06-14
17-11-06](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/121915462-8434a180-cd33-11eb-850f-9b7fd909639b.png)

Room names in French are automatically generated to avoid having to
think of a name.

Other bugs in the /conference mode have been solved.
name: ASTERiX

body:
[![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ed/Glacier_de_la_Grande_Casse_le_13_ao√ªt_2016.JPG/640px-Glacier_de_la_Grande_Casse_le_13_ao√ªt_2016.JPG)](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glacier_des_Grands_Couloirs)

> In short: we listen to each and every one of your feedbacks, and the
> improvement continues üîÑ

## üëÇ We're listening to you!

We've sorted and responded to over 300 feedbacks since the launch of Our
Climate Gestures, all on [the 'issues'
tab](https://github.com/betagouv/ecolab-data/issues).

This allows us to understand the problems of the calculator to
prioritize its improvement.

## Some simulation improvements

üö¥ Cyclosphere, hello! The issue of cycling makes its appearance in the
simulator, and in the "go to work other than by car" action, which
replaces "go to work by public transport". Walking üö∂‚ôÄÔ∏è and other modes
are not left out obviously üõ¥ ![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-02-08
15-42-24](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/107234732-4097f700-6a24-11eb-9f54-ff64cf66183f.png)

We'll let you guess the impact this quesiton has on the results ;)

We have also improved the input guides (e.g. number of houses: is it
with or without me?)

ü§≥ The phone question has been revised, now that all recent phones are
larger than 5 inches, and to take into account the 'no smartphone'
option.

üî•üå≤ The heating in steres of wood question becomes more relevant: it's
counted in steres, not kWh. We will continue to improve the other
entries soon (wood in pellets, fuel oil).

## Other improvements

New features (like this one you are reading) now appear directly on
https://nosgestesclimat.fr/nouveaut√©s, it's still more accessible than
[on github](https://github.com/betagouv/ecolab-data/releases) üôÇ

üêõ Several quite important bugs have been solved thanks to your feedback
(end of simulation always at 11 tons, default value input -> no
"next" button, etc.)

## Our roadmap

Now that the "issues" onget is clearer, it was time to put online our
roadmap on the simulator / calculation model side, it is in the
["Projects"
section](https://github.com/betagouv/ecolab-data/projects/1). Everything
is indicative, but it allows you to know what are our current topics.

> As for the interface, [this is the
> place](https://github.com/betagouv/ecolab-climat/milestones) to go to
> follow the progress.
name: Grands Couloirs

body:
[![Glacier du
Tour](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/50/Glacier_du_Tour_2021.jpg/270px-Glacier_du_Tour_2021.jpg)](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glacier_du_Tour)
*The Glacier du Tour is located in the Chamonix valley, a valley
accessible thanks to a superb mountain TER*

## Unpack your wardrobe

Finally, we no longer ask you the question of how much you *spend* on
textiles each year, which was too sensitive to the quality of your
purchases. Instead of counting 50kg CO2e for a t-shirt bought for 100‚Ç¨,
we count the t-shirt's footprint.

In return, it is up to you to catalog what you buy in general each year
(or on average each year). A not so simple exercise... but rather
interesting, no?

![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-08-24
08-57-41](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/130571129-d0be75f2-989a-4f84-858d-0c8ce803e561.png)

## Subcategory visualization

As you go through the questions in the simulation, see the footprint of
the subcategories at a glance.

![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-08-24
08-48-31](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/130569828-bee5d46a-0709-4e8a-ab6b-f94f54bbdf0d.png)

## Help notifications to understand the questions

![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-08-24
08-49-12](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/130569970-663eb9ac-4647-4943-b4de-befb12bcb7e2.png)

## Return of the "back" button

We had removed this button because it was leading to bugs, questions
were skipping and definitely falling into nothingness. Following
numerous requests, it is back and normally, without bugs!

![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-08-24
08-51-19](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/130570246-0bebdfc3-4fae-40c8-9011-6999713fdcf9.png)

## For those who heat with oil üõ¢Ô∏è

We have quietly changed the main input from kWh to liters. Of course
there is still the possibility to enter the price, we estimate the
consumption in liters at the quarterly rates published by the ministry.

## New personas.

We did not communicate much on this functionality, but nosgestesclimat
is equipped with a page `Personas`, which makes it possible to put
itself in the skin of some individuals to see their result of
simulation. It is here, and we added some: nosgestesclimat.fr/personas

> This page, improved, could become very important in the future: the
> personas could be designed to be representative of the French.

![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-08-24
08-54-43](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/130570763-0101210c-3f08-49af-b376-572b649ad5d4.png)

## Various improvements

We always listen carefully to your feedbacks!

### Input aids

we have improved the input help for the plane for those who don't take
it every year[(details
here](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/commit/e3d74925b8ff31d6cf40531e6a07a1f97c9f1237)),
and for the accommodation to accommodate less classical lifestyles
(camping car, truck, barge, [details
here](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/commit/e900598708402620bc3664500db4c1d111f24515).

### End screen

We added the decimal point in the final test score on the end screen

![ngc-fin-d√©cimale](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/130571538-ff8753ce-78c6-4d64-a63c-9128c015545e.gif)
name: Le Tour

body:
[![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/96420391-bf5af100-11f5-11eb-9662-fbcbd1445ea0.png)](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glacier_d'Argenti√®re)

> In short: introduction of the action sheets and a better car model

## Integration of the action sheets

After the simulation, we now offer you a list of actions that
significantly reduce your footprint.

![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-01-25
11-23-53](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/105693284-d2b9de80-5eff-11eb-8229-9c7dfd4f2a63.png)

We have also integrated a detailed documentation for each of these
actions ![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-01-25
11-26-37](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/105693599-347a4880-5f00-11eb-94c2-51a179b8bd48.png)

## Big improvement of the model: the construction of the vehicle üöó

It is now amortized over several years. Previously, it was depreciated
over age, so an electric car bought 1 year ago would have its 12 tons
attributed to that first year all at once, among other problems.

The depreciation method is explained
[here](https://ecolab.ademe.fr/apps/climat/documentation/transport/voiture/amortissement-particulier).

We also forgot to divide the construction of the vehicle by the number
of passengers, as it was done for the use of the car.

See \#674 for all the thinking behind it.

## Other improvements ‚ú®

It is clarified that we are asking for the energy consumption of the
household, not the individual. This is especially thoughtful for
collocates who may each have their own amount in mind.

We improved the texts of the questions on cars, and better documented
the calculations.
name: Argenti√®re

body:
![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bb/MONTE_PERDIDO.JPG/640px-MONTE_PERDIDO.JPG)

> In short: the nosgestesclimat.fr calculation engine has been
> completely modernized

In this version, not much changes for users, and that's even the goal:
to completely revise the underlying code without introducing any :bug: .

Our Climate Gestures is now cleanly based on publi.codes. We have thus
made up for the 8 months of improvements that the betagouv/my-company
team made to this language, and removed the mountain of code that
represented publicodes and that we were not actively developing here
:+1:

![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-01-25
11-20-07](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/105692891-4a3b3e00-5eff-11eb-93a3-91bfd9c78378.png)

We have thus taken one more step in the openness, readability, and
reproducibility of the calculation model we are developing here, and
thus one more step towards an individual climate footprint calculation
model that would serve as a reference.
name: Mont-Perdu

body:
[![p√©riades](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/116311567-ac7c3700-a7ab-11eb-8f01-8d486e2706f3.jpeg)](https://fr.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glacier_des_P√©riades)

> In summary: - new questions and model for taking into account the age
> and the construction materials of the dwelling - lots of new climate
> actions - a conference mode in preparation, already testable - bugs
> solved

## Age of housing

Previously, a dwelling built in 1901 had an annual construction
footprint, as much as a dwelling built in 2019. Ouch. That's fixed.

-   age of the house -> taking into account or not a footprint, the
    houses > 50 years old are now zero
-   declination house vs apartment
-   declination traditional construction (concrete I think) vs eco-built

See https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/pull/994

## Lots of new gestures to take action :boxing\_glove:

Which brings us to a good twenty!

![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-04-27
17-51-06](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/116272451-32cf5380-a781-11eb-8601-0e6ac7e83f9e.png)

![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-04-27
17-51-13](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/116272430-2d720900-a781-11eb-9786-e09c5f5e8fcc.png)

But also: - switch to LEDs at home - do without the car for trips <
5km - abandon the tumble dryer - replace my gas boiler with oil

After a last salvo, we will move on to improving the UX of this "climate
action" part.

## A "conference" mode in preparation

On the PR number
[222](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/pull/222), you can
follow the progress of a brand new simulation mode for our climate
gestures : make the simulation with several people !

It will be useful for conferences, for workshops, but also to simply
test it with friends.

To test it, [it is here üèπ
üèπ](https://conf--nosgestesclimat.netlify.app/conf√©rence)

![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-04-27
17-59-21](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/116273752-5515a100-a782-11eb-8483-c378c2c7406e.png)

## Bonus : obsolescence of computer equipment

We have heart to fight against the digital footprint by not neglecting
the devices that have a lower definition than the current standard. Here
is a small improvement that goes in this direction:
https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/issues/995
name: P√©riades

body:
[![Glacier de
Taconnaz](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c8/Taconnaz.JPG/576px-Taconnaz.JPG)](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glacier_de_Taconnaz)

> In short: - redesign of the action path üéØ: slip actions into your cart
> to reduce your footprint. - the fish menu üêüÔ∏è has finally arrived! - a
> new permanent menu makes it easier to navigate - you can now share
> your conference links with a QRcode

## A new path to action üéØ

Many users were complaining about the simplicity of our move-to-action
path. We've redesigned it entirely, bringing it closer to a mini-game
where the goal is to reduce your footprint.

![ngc-action-2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/139829768-5759d428-1e0d-4c7d-9fd3-682dbebb1b90.gif)

This is just the beginning: we have already planned the [next
steps](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/issues/359) to
make engagement even easier.

We're also introducing *personas*: typical profiles you can select to
experience the action journey as a given citizen.

## The menu üêüÔ∏è

We've received dozens of requests to integrate a fish menu on the diet
choice screen. There are now 2!

![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-11-02
11-29-03](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/139830102-bd7cee54-c1fd-454c-8eb0-7ce2a750ffa8.png)

These new dishes were made from the [Agribalyse](https://agribalyse.fr/)
database, and the calculation is of course *open*. Many new features on
food will follow.

## A new menu for the application

Nosgestesclimat is designed to be used on mobile as on desktop. The
mobile version now has a permanent menu at the bottom of the screen, and
the desktop version has a new arrangement in two columns, with a menu
also present on the left.

![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-11-02
11-31-33](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/139830463-203c8896-0eda-49ad-ba45-be1a19e180de.png)

This new menu makes the application more accessible, and it's just one
of many accessibility improvements we have
[planned](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/issues/350).

## The French average is now 9 tons!

Unfortunately, this does not reflect unexpected efforts, but an
improvement of the calculation method of the Ministry of the
Environment.

The good news is that the French administration is taking the issue
seriously, improving its calculations and explaining the differences in
a scientific way.

Detailed explanations
[here](https://twitter.com/maeool/status/1453282887583866885).

So why do we show an average of 9.8 tons in the simulator? Because our
calculation is made using another method than the government one,
complementary. More info
[here](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/issues/365#issuecomment-957321261).

## Conference mode improvements üèüÔ∏è

This collective mode of using ourclimategests is more and more used. To
facilitate the sharing of the link at the beginning of the conference,
we generate a super QRCode that you just have to project or send by
email ![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-11-02
11-32-27](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/139830597-63fe1856-5622-4c52-b7f4-23ccbfaa6bd9.png).

Another improvement is that we exclude from the group's results
simulations that have resulted in a footprint that is too high, above
100 tons. This limit will be configurable soon.

## Technical improvements üêá

We continue to lighten the site, removing a graphic animation library
(react-spring) and better cutting the conference mode from the rest of
the application.

Of course, many reported bugs have also been fixed.
name: Taconnaz

body:
[![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/f/f3/Merdeglace.jpg)](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mer_de_Glace)

## Our Climate Gestures, v1

> In summary:
>
> -   the action screen has been completely redesigned with two paths
>     and more gestures
> -   the application has been partially redesigned: it is more modern
>     and pleasant to use, especially on cell phones
> -   we introduce *personas*, to better work on the next actions
> -   share your simulation result on the networks, and people will see
>     directly a capture of your assessment!

## Take action

We have completely redesigned the action screen.

We now have access to two modes, a guided mode where actions are sorted
by us, and a standalone mode that allows us to tackle the biggest
reduction actions.

![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-03-29
15-53-21](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/112846986-e5d75f00-90a6-11eb-8ca0-1be5736d5d9c.png)

The selection of gestures is now more complete, there are now 17, in all
categories.

![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-03-29
15-54-28](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/112847173-161efd80-90a7-11eb-8f47-283dd1eb418a.png)

## Redesign of the application, especially on mobile

-   we adopt the conventions of the modern mobile, with navigation
    buttons accessible with the finger at the bottom, and a session bar
    that gives the result of simulation also at the bottom and permanent

![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-03-29 11-05-15
resized](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/112813673-c3c9e680-907e-11eb-94c9-b818073b7c45.png)

-   on the action screen, the session bar remains predictable, in the
    same place but with the color of the category

![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-03-29 11-07-12
resized](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/112813831-f07dfe00-907e-11eb-9d4c-240dbaa7d74a.png)

-   we have gained vertical space on mobile. Why is this important? To
    make phones < 6 inches last. Not because 6 inches is bad, but
    because changing phones just for the screen is a shame. It won't
    revolutionize our footprint, but it's something!

Before ![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-03-29 10-52-39
resized](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/112813510-8ebd9400-907e-11eb-8db7-e2291ed24eaa.png)
After ![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-03-29 10-52-51
resized](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/112813516-8f562a80-907e-11eb-9ead-773133ff889c.png)

## Simulation sharing

Big new feature that allows you to preview the results of a simulation
when sharing on social networks. We hope to improve the diffusion of the
application. Below is a Whatsapp capture.

![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/112972961-1d9ae100-9151-11eb-9f34-bc3061ca35da.png)

See [this PR](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/pull/208).

\#\# Introduction of personas

This system, to be populated with profiles if possible representative of
the population, will allow us to better test and develop the
application.

![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-03-29
15-50-57](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/112846716-a14bc380-90a6-11eb-8060-219bed3d3ddf.png)

## Bug fixes

We corrected a big bug: the "previous" button of the simulation was
badly done. We removed it, fixed the same problem that affected the "my
answers" button, which now becomes the only way to modify your answers.
It has been widely promoted.
name: Mer de Glace

body:
[![Glacier de
Tr√©-la-T√™te](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e3/Glacier_de_Tr√©-la-T√™te.jpg/640px-Glacier_de_Tr√©-la-T√™te.jpg)](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glacier_de_Tr√©-la-T√™te)

> This glacier of Tr√©-la-T√™te is the 4th largest glacier in France. An
> [interesting](https://www.francetvinfo.fr/meteo/canicule/video-un-glaciologue-repond-a-cinq-questions-sur-les-glaciers_5283679.html)
> üìΩÔ∏è [Brut video about it following the unusual summer of 2022
> (29/07/2022)](https://www.francetvinfo.fr/meteo/canicule/video-un-glaciologue-repond-a-cinq-questions-sur-les-glaciers_5283679.html)

> **In short**: - new logo, new iconography, new homepage - a lot of
> small improvements to the site and the calculation model

## üé® A new logo, a new homepage, and new icons

You won't have missed it, Our Climate Gestures is getting a new logo ü•≥.

![](https://nosgestesclimat.fr/images/petit-logo.png)

Frequently quoted in the press, it will go even less unnoticed there.

Here are a few extracts from the last two weeks alone ‚¨áÔ∏è Article from
\[Ouest-France\](https://www.ouest-france.fr/bretagne/carhaix-plouguer-29270/a-carhaix-ces-specialistes-de-l-energie-donnent-leurs-conseils-pour-consommer-moins-bc1250aa-3346-11ed-8dd8-fdb9fa809eb1):
In Carhaix, these energy specialists give their advice to consume less
> It is also possible to calculate its carbon footprint on
nosgestesclimat.fr Article from \[France
Inter\](https://www.radiofrance.fr/franceinter/un-champion-de-trail-nous-explique-pourquoi-il-renonce-a-une-course-en-raison-de-son-bilan-carbone-7787049)
: A high level runner explains why he gives up the Worlds because of his
carbon footprint > Andy Symonds has calculated, via the website "Nos
gestes climat", that flying to Thailand would explode his carbon
footprint. Le Dauphin√© Lib√©r√© \[launched a poll and quotes
NGC\](https://www.ledauphine.com/environnement/2022/09/21/les-citoyens-attendent-que-l-etat-les-accompagne-dans-leurs-efforts)
Find the results of our poll "The French and their carbon footprint"
> A French person emits on average 11.2 tons of CO2e per year.
Experts estimate that this figure should be limited to 2 tons per year
to slow down climate change and respect the objectives of the Paris
Agreement. To find out your carbon footprint, Ademe has launched an
online tool called "Our climate actions". As well as
\[outside.fr\](https://www.outside.fr/comment-evaluer-votre-empreinte-carbone-les-3-meilleurs-calculateurs).

The homepage follows this graphic evolution with a few paragraphs to
introduce the subject (and its limits).

### Before

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/191323489-088461c2-b1b9-46fe-bce2-c1e459104569.png)

### After

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/191323550-993c5109-ae91-4baa-8853-af240bf4c279.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/191323669-952493a1-7b17-4d38-a48b-313f2a592863.png)

In the same way, we worked on [the style and readability of
the](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/pull/570) business
[icons](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/pull/570)
throughout the site.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/192312016-67af3382-6e02-49db-b791-8ba1702eb0ce.png)

## üêé Performance (eco-design)

We finished phase 2 of our sobriety work, in terms of site weight, with
a [significant
gain](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/pull/602). It's
all relative, but a little sobriety on our end is the least we can do!

## üëÜÔ∏è Other interface improvements

-   The [survey mode](https://nosgestesclimat.fr/groupe) is no longer in
    beta, it has already been used by hundreds of organizations
-   a notification appears when your home is depreciated (= built a long
    time ago): in this case, we don't ask you its surface notably
    (because we don't need it for the calculation), this surprised some
    users
-   the input of numbers in the questionnaire is now more constrained
    (you can't enter zero passengers in the car for example) to reduce
    the errors that can cause non-expected values (infinite or null
    values)
-   the button "I don't know" appears in the mosaics
    (https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/pull/604)
-   the accessibility certificate
    (https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/pull/621) is
    online, testifying to our work on this important aspect of Web sites

Overall, a lot of work has been done on sorting and closing hundreds of
return tickets, [on the template
side](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/issues) as well as [on
the site side](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/issues),
the contribution of as many people as possible always remains our
priority.

## üßÆ On the model side

-   update of the [aircraft emission
    factors](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/pull/1489)
-   the "consumption" part of the tea [is already included in your
    electricity
    bill](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/pull/1494), it was
    a bug spotted thanks to our parallel work on
    [monconvertisseurco2.fr](https://monconvertisseurco2.fr/empreinte-carbone/boisson)
-   the emission factor of the French electricity mix for 2021 [is
    updated](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/pull/1484)

## üåÖ Coming soon...

We are currently working on a regionalization (overseas) and
internationalization of the site üòé. See you soon!
name: Tr√©-la-T√™te
